title: Bajaj Auto's 2Q Net Profit Rose 21% on Year Despite Drop in Sales
text:
By Kosaku Narioka

Bajaj Auto Ltd. (532977.BY) reported a 21% increase in second-quarter net profit from a year earlier, partly due to lower tax expenses, despite a drop in sales.

Net profit for the July-September quarter was 15.23 billion Indian rupees ($215.1 million), compared with INR12.57 billion a year ago, the Indian automaker said Wednesday.

That beat the mean estimate of INR11.85 billion by analysts polled by S&P Global Market Intelligence.

Revenue fell 4.1% to INR77.07 billion, the company said. Domestic motorcycle sales for the quarter fell particularly sharply, dropping 25% from a year earlier, Bajaj Auto said.

Write to Kosaku Narioka at kosaku.narioka@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 23, 2019 04:37 ET (08:37 GMT)
